RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 95. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 35000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $8,000 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOVEREIGN OF SPEED dueled for the early lead two to three wide, made a four wide bid off the turn and edged clear in the furlong grounds to prove best under a drive. ARISTOCRATIC dueled for the lead on the inside and came three wide off the turn and was outfinished by the winner, second best. SAN COSTANTINO was bumped at the start, reserved early, saved ground on the turn and split rivals by the three sixteenths and rallied. ROYAL SPY tracked the pace along the inside and made a bid on the inside leaving the turn but needed more late. ASKIN FOR A BASKIN tracked the pace three wide and then was between rivals by the five sixteenths and put to a drive and weakened in the drive. FREE SQUARE broke awkwardly at the start, then raced four wide on the turn and came wide into the lane and was empty. PER THE HORSE RACING INTEGRITY AND WELFARE UNIT, ARISTOCRATIC HAS BEEN DQ'D FOR A POSITIVE TEST.

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Aristocratic
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside, 3 wide 1/4, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Spy
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, bid inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: San Costantino
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, reserved inside, split rivals 3/16, rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Free Square
ENTRY.OWNER: Team Gaudet and Braude Herman M
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke awkwardly, 4 wide turn, came wide upper stretch, empty,

ENTRY.NAME: Askin for a Baskin
ENTRY.OWNER: Lugamo Racing Stable LLC and J R Sanchez Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, between horses 5/16, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Sovereign of Speed
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2-3 wide, bid 4 wide, edged clear, driving,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 2 1 1/8M Inner turf CR: 63. Maiden Claiming Purse 40000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $16,000 In Last 5 Starts). (Rail at 37 feet). this race over the Turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Eighth).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KOBE'S SMILE reserved at the read of the field for the first half mile under patient handling, rallied four wide in the turn while still in hand to engage the leaders turning for home and drew off through the lane. SHOPPINGATBLOOMIES well placed to be stalking the leaders in the second pair along the fence, split horses turning for home and finished well chasing the winner down the lane to be second best. RIA FORMOSA unhurried early while trailing in the back pair down the backside, angled wide in upper stretch and found her best stride late to be gaining down the lane. VANA BRIGHT tracked the pace from the rail early on, lost position in the far turn while waiting behind horses and closed up the fence down the stretch. TIME GOES FAST rated off the pace in the third pair to be in striking distance turning for home and lacked the needed kick in the drive. REES stalked the pace from two wide down the backside, ranged up to loom boldly in the turn and flattened out in the lane. REAL MIKEY pulled early down the lane the first time to duel on the lead from the rail, disposed of the pace pressure briefly into the turn and gave way turning for home. SHADES OF BLUE vied for the lead for a half mile and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Vana Bright
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked early, lost position, rail rally

ENTRY.NAME: Time Goes Fast
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated off pace, lacked bid

ENTRY.NAME: Ria Formosa
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, angled wide, best stride late, belated rally

ENTRY.NAME: Real Mikey
ENTRY.COMMENT: pulled early, dueled inside, cleared briefly, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Shoppingatbloomies
ENTRY.OWNER: Beast Mode Racing LLC and America's Pastime Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, finished well, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Shades of Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied lead, through early,

ENTRY.NAME: Rees
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, ranged up, loomed, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Kobe's Smile
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, rallied in hand, swept to lead, much best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 90. Claiming Purse 34500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) ( Condition Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHARGING AERO pressed the pace and made a three wide bid off the turn to take over, then was confronted by SUMO by the furlong marker and dueled to the inside of that rival, then moved to the inside of the loose horse and prevailed late under a drive. SUMO was rated early, made a four wide move on the turn and dueled for the lead by the furlong marker, then had to move to the outside of the loose horse and was out gamed late to just miss. ASSERT DOMINANCE chased the pace three wide and came four wide into the lane and was up for the show award. SPRITZER set a pressured pace on the inside, then weakened in the drive, lost show award late. ERLAN chased the pace on the inside and had no rally. NO ME DIGAS was settled two wide on the turn, swung out five wide leaving the turn and was not a threat. QUINCANNON was well placed early towards the inside, two wide by the quarter pole and weakened. ASHAAB was settled four to five wide and was not a threat. BALI'S SHADE was fractious in the gate, unprepared at the start, lost rider when sent off, walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Erlan
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, saved ground turn, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: No Me Digas
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 2 wide turn, swung 5 wide, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Bali's Shade
ENTRY.COMMENT: fraftious gate, unprepared start, lost rider start,

ENTRY.NAME: Quincannon
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside, 2 wide 1/4 pole, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Assert Dominance
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, 3 wide turn, came 4 wide, up for 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Sumo
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated early, 4 wide move, dueled, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Spritzer
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, weakened stretch, lost 3rd late

ENTRY.NAME: Ashaab
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 4 wide, wide trip, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Charging Aero
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 3 wide, bid 3 wide, dueled 1/8, prevailed, driving,

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Carol A. Reitman, Susan Gannon & Warren Miller

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 90000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, VA RESTRICTED, OR STATE BRED OR CLAIMING PRICE $100,000 OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, VA RESTRICT ED, OR STATE BRED IN 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $100,000 (Races Where Entered For $50,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Condition Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BRAGANZA reserved off the pace racing along the fence, waited in the turn for racing room briefly, tipped out to split rivals in upper stretch and was up in the final stride. INTREPID DAYDREAM stalked the pace through the turn, assumed command in upper stretch, kept on through the lane in a drive and was caught on the wire in a good effort. JOKE SISI (CHI) tracked the leaders from just off the pace through the turn, rallied in mid-stretch to loom large and was out-finished late in the drive. MILAGROSA SURENA (ARG) trailed to midway down the lane and rallied mildly late while never posing a threat. BENEATH THE STARS rushed up the fence to take the lead shortly from the gate, opened a clear advantage to midway on the turn and weakened coming home.

ENTRY.NAME: Beneath the Stars
ENTRY.OWNER: Team Gaudet David A Bernsen LLC and Wilson Susanna
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, rushed inside, clear lead, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Braganza
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, waited turn, tipped out, up in final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Milagrosa Surena (ARG)

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of SI

ENTRY.COMMENT: mild late bid, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Intrepid Daydream
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, assumed command, gamely, nailed

ENTRY.NAME: Joke Sisi (CHI)
ENTRY.OWNER: Merriebelle Stable LLC and Microstar Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked, bid upper, loomed, out-finished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 5 5 1/2F Outer turf CR: 89. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 35000. OUTER TURF FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $8,000 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12 ,500 (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances). (Rail at 107 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LUCCI set a pressured pace on the inside, then dueled for command by the quarter pole, then made a bid to gain a short lead by the furlong marker and held sway late to prove best, driving. CHARMED (GB) pressed the pace and made a two wide bid on the turn to duel for command, then was out-kicked in the drive while holding on to the place award. MY BOY BLUE tracked the pace from the inside, came two wide into the lane and then angled in to the rail and was gaining late to just miss the place award. INDEFATIGABLE tracked the pace three wide, made a four wide bid off the turn to loom boldly but flattened out late. LOVE YOU MUCH was settled early and two wide and in between rivals on the turn and had a mild late kick. SLIPPIN JIMMY was allowed to settle on the inside and had no rally while racing evenly. E J'S REVENGE chased the pace four wide and weakened. UNCLE ANDREW was settled early, between rivals and three wide on the turn and had no rally.

ENTRY.NAME: Lucci
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, dueled 1/4, bid, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: My Boy Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, bid inside, missed 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Slippin Jimmy
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground turn, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Charmed (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 2 wide, bid 2 wide, out-kicked, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Love You Much
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, between rivals 2 wide turn, mild rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Indefatigable
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, bid 4 wide, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: E J's Revenge
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 4 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Uncle Andrew
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 3 wide turn, between turn, no rally,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 6 1 3/16M Outer turf CR: 93. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 80000. OUTER TURF FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR VA RESTRICTED OR CLAIMING PRICE $50,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 1 Al lowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000 (Races Where Entered For $32,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Condition Eligibility). (Rail at 107 feet). h).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FEBRUARY SON slow early to trail the field for the first half mile, made a steady gain to the field into the turn, waited to swing wide under patient handling until straightening out for home and was up in time in a determined drive. NO ONE TO BLAME well placed throughout while stalking the pace from two wide, rallied three wide in the final bend to take command in mid-stretch and was caught in the final strides. CARRONADE settled in hand to track the pace in the clear down the backside, circled up three wide to loom boldly down the lane and was out-finished late in the going. FLOP SHOT (IRE) tracked the pace along the fence in striking position and lacked a closing kick down the lane. SCANNO prompted the pace throughout, made a threatening bid in upper stretch and weakened late. EPIC LUCK set the pace on a comfortable lead to the quarter pole, responded when challenged turning for home and tired. GIRL DAD was never a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Flop Shot (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: No One to Blame
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, 3 wide bid, led stretch, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Epic Luck
ENTRY.OWNER: Ashby Lynn A and Gotwals William R
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, cleared, tired

ENTRY.NAME: February Son
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, steady gain, angled wide, determined

ENTRY.NAME: Girl Dad
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Scanno
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Carronade
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled in hand, bid stretch, loomed, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 7 5 1/2F Outer turf CR: 84. Claiming Purse 40000. OUTER TURF FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $30,000, if for $25,000, allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $20,00 0 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Condition Eligibility). (Rail at 107 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COVERT KAT was settled two to three wide early, came four wide into the lane, then steadied slightly nearing the furlong marker, then closed well and edged clear late to prove best, driving. WALT WHITMAN (IRE) was rated along nicely on the inside, coaxed along on the turn and eased off the inside, then drifted out five wide while making a bid off the turn to take over, then was roused by the furlong marker but was outfinished by the winner. DARK AND FITZY was reserved early three wide, shifted out and was seven wide by the quarter pole, then came widest into the lane and finished well. FREESTANDING was allowed to settle early, advanced on the inside on the turn, swung out three wide leaving the turn while making a bid but flattened out late. TIZ A TALE was reserved early on the inside, saved ground off the turn, then steadied nearing the furlong marker and then had a belated rally. EVENLY DIVIDED tracked the pace three wide, then was in tight by the quarter pole and weakened. KING OF SONG vied for the lead on the inside and weakened in the drive. BEST DEFENSE vied for the lead two wide and then weakened in the drive. OFFICER STONE showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz a Tale
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, steadied 1/8, bealtedly

ENTRY.NAME: Walt Whitman (IRE)
ENTRY.OWNER: Dancing Wind Stables LLC and Azpurua Sr Eduardo
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, eased out turn, bid 5 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Officer Stone
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little,

ENTRY.NAME: Dark and Fitzy
ENTRY.OWNER: Rashid's Thoroughbred Racing and LBR Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved 3 wide, 7 wide 1/4 pole, came wide, rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Freestanding
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled early, inside turn, swung 3 wide, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: King of Song
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead inside, weakened stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Evenly Divided
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, in tight 1/4, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Covert Kat
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, came 4 wide, steadied 1/8, closed, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Best Defense
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead 2 wide, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 8 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 64. Maiden Claiming Purse 55000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000 (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less $20,000). (Rail at 37 feet). One Sixteenth).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISSION READY slow early to be at the back through the first turn, steadily gained ground down the backstretch, circled wide at the top of the lane and closed well late to be up in time. GRAND KINGDOM set a pressured pace throughout, shook off the pressure in mid-stretch and was caught late in a good effort. MASTEROFHISCRAFT raced three wide into the first turn, was bumped badly by rank rival, settled to track the pace down the backside while racing wide and rallied well down the lane to gain the show. STARLIFTER stalked the pace to the head of the lane, made a bid to mid-stretch while weaving out and in through the lane impeding closing rivals and finished evenly. PIRATE RADIO pressed the pace from two wide to mid-stretch and weakened late in the lane. DUSTIN THE DIAMOND reserved along the rail while well placed, tipped out turning for home, rallied in the lane and was blocked in traffic repeatedly having no where to go. KING'S RIVER raced down the lane the first time under stout restraint, pulled into the first turn and angled out sharply bumping MASTEROFHISCRAFT severely, then dropped back down the backstretch and was never a threat. IMPERIAL THUNDER chased the pace for three quarters and flattened out. HONG KONG BOY was always outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Mission Ready
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, steady gain, circled wide, best stride late, in time

ENTRY.NAME: Dustin the Diamond
ENTRY.OWNER: Allshouse Brad and M and J Thoroughbreds LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, rail trip, angled out, blocked in traffic

ENTRY.NAME: King's River
ENTRY.COMMENT: stout resistance, pulled early, rank, bumped rival, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Imperial Thunder
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Starlifter
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, bid upper, erratic stretch, flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Grand Kingdom
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, gamely, kept on, good efort

ENTRY.NAME: Pirate Radio
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Hong Kong Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor, outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Masterofhiscraft
ENTRY.OWNER: Dare To Dream Stable LLC (Michael Faber)
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped 1st turn, raced wide, settled, late gain

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 9 5 1/2F Outer turf CR: 74. Maiden Claiming Purse 40000. OUTER TURF FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $30,000, For Each $2,500 To $25,000 2 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $20,000 In Last 5 Starts). (Rail at 107 fee t).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MORE THAN FIVE was well rated early three wide, made a four wide move and continued that move off the turn and edged clear late to prove best under a drive. ROCK WITH YOU was bumped hard at the start, set a pressured pace on the inside, then made a bid leaving the turn to shake clear, but could not hold off the winner late, second best. CODE NAME broke outwardly and bumped a rival hard at the start, then tracked pace on the inside, made a mild bid on the inside but needed more under a hesitant ride while gaining the show award. EL BAILADOR pressed the pace and made a two wide bid on the turn to duel for command, but faded losing the show award late. RENNIE was allowed to settle early, saved ground on the turn, swung out three wide leaving the turn and made a mild bid but flattened out. SENSE OF GOLDEN was settled back early and lacked a serious rally. KAMIKAZE FOX chased the pace four to three wide and weakened. RAMBUNCTIOUS RIDE was squeezed back and checked at the start and then was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Code Name
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outwardly, bumped rival, tracked inside,needed more,got 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Rock With You
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, set pressured pace inside, shook clear 1/8, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Rambunctious Ride
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed back, checked start, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: El Bailador
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 2 wide, bid 2 wide, faded, lost 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Sense of Golden
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Rennie
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, inside turn, swung 3 wide, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: More Than Five
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 3 wide, 4 wide move, edged clear late, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Kamikaze Fox
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 4-3 wide, weakened,
